name: Kepler-374
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-374 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-374 is a star with 0.8149999999999998 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.91 times its radius. It is located 4281.35 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-374 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-374 b

Kepler-374 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 1.90 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-374.

The mass of Kepler-374 b is 1.04 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-374 b is 1.03 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, Kepler-374 b is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.

Kepler-374 c

Kepler-374 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 3.28 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-374.

The mass of Kepler-374 c is 1.21 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-374 c is 1.1 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, Kepler-374 c is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.

Kepler-374 d

Kepler-374 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 5.03 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-374.

The mass of Kepler-374 d is 1.84 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-374 d is 1.31 that of Earth. At 1.84 Earth masses, Kepler-374 d is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-374, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
